articles.author: Nick Dole
articles.title: Emmanuel Macron may be the de facto leader of Europe, but could he lose the French presidency to rival Marine Le Pen? - ABC News
articles.description: Emmanuel Macron's status as Europe's de facto leader, which has been cemented by the current crisis in Ukraine, certainly aligns with his ambitions. But could it cost him the French presidency?
articles.content:
To get a glimpse of how world leaders wish to be viewed, their official photographs are a good place to start.
For several months, French President Emmanuel Macron has been presenting the image of a… [+10578 chars]

articles.title: How Russia captured 'prized' city of Mariupol after weeks of intense fighting - Times of India
articles.description: Europe News: NEW DELHI: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday claimed victory in the strategic port of Mariupol, even as he ordered his troops not to storm .

articles.author: Joseph Gerrard
articles.title: The number of Hull families who have offered to take in Ukrainian refugees revealed - Hull Live
articles.description: The offers to house Ukrainians come as Government figures show more than 56,000 visas have been granted to people from the Eastern European country since Russia invaded in February
articles.content: A total of 70 Hull households have volunteered to take in Ukrainian refugees, latest figures reveal today. Hull City Council has also revealed Guildhall officials are in contact with 17 adults and si… [+3766 chars]

articles.title: EU plan for common worldwide phone charger port takes step closer - CNA
articles.description:
BRUSSELS: The European Union's bid to adopt a common charging port for mobile phones, tablets and headphones took a step forward on Wednesday (Apr 20) when an EU panel backed the proposal, paving the way for an assembly vote next month.
